titleStmt.title: James P. O'Hara et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9174

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency the Hon. B. Magoffin Gov. of Commonwealth Ky

Your petitioners that Tho Callaghan was fined the sum of twenty dollars for selling a single drink of whisky at the last term of the Franklin circuit court. now we whose names are hereunto subscribed respectfully ask of your Excellency to remit said fine because the said Callaghan is a good citizen. a law abiding man. and did not intend to violate the law -- for as much as the liquor was sold by his clerk and not by himself. and there was no proof that it was sold by his knowledge consent or advice. In view of all this we pray the fine may be remited. & we will ever pray & &.

Jas P. OHara
R A Bohannon
Michael Buckley
H Hardee
Dan Magher
James Sullivan
B. F Johnson
J M. Lancaster
Nelson Alley
W H Greenup

Franklin Cir Ct
$20 } Liquor
Tho Callaghan
Remission Issd Aug 16 1862
